p.i: The House met at half-past Nine o'clock

speech.p: It may be for the convenience of the House if I indicate that after calling on all hon. Members in the Chamber to take the Oath of to Affirm I shall suspend the Sitting until 11 am. That will be the last occasion today. On Wednesday next I shall be in the Chair from 2.30 pm.

p.i: The following Members took and subscribed the Oath, or made and subscribed the Affirmation required by Law:

speech.p: The sitting is suspended until 11 o'clock.

p.i: The following Members took and subscribed the Oath, or made and subscribed the Affirmation required by Law

ul.li: Sir Julian Errington Ridsdale, CBE, Harwich.

p.q: That this House do now adjourn till Wednesday 24 June.—[Mr. Lennox-Boyd.]

p.i: Adjourned accordingly at half-past Eleven o'clock.
